lines.text:
[in the discotheque]
You can still turn back.

[dressed as Carl Parsons]
Oh no, no way.
All right. If you try to pick up somebody I'm gonna tell on you.
Yeah, well, if you try to pick up somebody, I'll kill you!

[in Mark's office celebrating Carly's article publication in the Village Voice]
When can you move back in?
Tomorrow's fine. I've got to go to New York.
Well... I have to, Mark. It's just for a week. The Voice needs me to edit the copy, I've got to take pictures...
Oh, fine, hey! I guess I know where I stand!

You really are something, you know that? Well, I'm beginning to understand it all now. It was never Carl, was it? It was me! You didn't like what was happening to me, and all this time you had me thinking that you were on my side. You told me I should believe in myself! And you told me to "get out there and go get 'em!"

Sure! Sure, it's easy when you have a little nine-to-five job. What do you think my writing is? A hobby? "Sure, Carly, go ahead, be a writer; just make sure that you're home by six and free on the weekends!" Let me tell you something, Mark. My work is just as important as yours! And I thought you understood that! But I guess I was wrong!
